entries.content: When a prospect reacts negatively (e.g., groans) to the perceived nature of your call, ask a clarifying question like 'Why does everybody say that?' to understand the root cause of their frustration.
entries.notes: Used after an opener that anticipates a common negative reaction in high-volume call industries.

entries.content: Asking 'Why does everybody say that?' encourages the prospect to vent about their negative experiences with similar calls, revealing the underlying reasons for their resistance.
entries.notes: This venting process helps the agent understand the specific pain points or objections related to receiving cold calls in their industry.

entries.content: The goal of asking a clarifying question after a negative reaction is to get the prospect to open up and explain the root cause of their objection or frustration.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
